question_text: If you don't want to use your monitor's exact native resolution, what's the best alternative approach?
answer_options: Use any resolution close to the native resolution
Use a multiple of the native resolution for better scaling
Always use the lowest resolution for maximum compatibility
Use the highest possible resolution regardless of scaling
correct_answer: Use a multiple of the native resolution for better scaling
explanation: If you can't use native resolution, using a multiple (like half or double) provides better scaling results. This allows more predictable pixel mapping and reduces the scaling artifacts that make text and graphics appear fuzzy.
